alert.note: Alert for Coastal New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued April 07 at 8:09PM EDT until April 09 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EDT SATURDAY THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM SATURDAY TO 9 PM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, Strong north to south longshore current. There is also a Moderate Risk of rip currents expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 6 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Coastal New Hanover County. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, from 6 AM EDT Saturday through Saturday evening. For the High Surf Advisory, from 8 AM Saturday to 9 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Longshore currents can sweep swimmers and surfers into rip currents, piers, jetties, and other hazardous areas. It may sweep swimmers off their feet, making it difficult to return to shore.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Caution should be used when in or near the water. Check with lifeguards before entering the ocean for possible hazards you may be swept into.
